How do I say 'hello' in Japanese?: In Japanese, 'hello' is 'こんにちは' (konnichiwa). For morning, use 'おはようございます' (ohayou gozaimasu), and for evening use 'こんばんは' (konbanwa).
How do I say 'thank you' in Japanese?: In Japanese, 'thank you' is 'ありがとう' (arigatou). The polite form is 'ありがとうございます' (arigatou gozaimasu).
How do I say 'goodbye' in Japanese?: In Japanese, 'goodbye' is 'さようなら' (sayounara). For casual situations, you can use 'じゃあね' (jaa ne).
What's the difference between は and が?: は (wa) marks the topic of the sentence, while が (ga) marks the subject. は is used for known information or contrast, while が is used for new information or emphasis.
How do I count objects in Japanese?: Japanese uses different counters based on the type of object. Common ones: つ (tsu) for general items, 人 (nin) for people, 本 (hon) for long objects, 枚 (mai) for flat objects.
What's the polite form of 食べる?: The polite form of 食べる (taberu) is 食べます (tabemasu). For past tense: 食べました (tabemashita). For negative: 食べません (tabemasen).
How do I say 'Where is the train station: 駅はどこですか？ (Eki wa doko desu ka?) is how you say 'Where is the train station?' in Japanese. A more polite version is 駅はどちらですか？ (Eki wa dochira desu ka?)
What are basic greetings in Japanese?:
Basic Japanese greetings:
- Morning: おはようございます (ohayou gozaimasu)
- Daytime: こんにちは (konnichiwa)
- Evening: こんばんは (konbanwa)
- Goodbye: さようなら (sayounara)
How do I introduce myself in Japanese?: Basic self-introduction: 初めまして。[Your Name]です。よろしくお願いします。(Hajimemashite. [Your Name] desu. Yoroshiku onegaishimasu.)
What are the basic particles in Japanese:
Common Japanese particles:
- は (wa): topic marker
- が (ga): subject marker
- を (wo): object marker
- に (ni): location/target
- で (de): location of action/means
How do I ask 'what' in Japanese?:
To ask 'what' in Japanese:
- なに/何 (nani): general 'what'
- どれ (dore): which one
- どの (dono): which (when followed by a noun)
- どう (dou): how/in what way
What are the basic numbers in Japanese?:
Basic numbers in Japanese:
1: 一 (ichi)
2: 二 (ni)
3: 三 (san)
4: 四 (yon/shi)
5: 五 (go)
6: 六 (roku)
7: 七 (nana/shichi)
8: 八 (hachi)
9: 九 (kyuu/ku)
10: 十 (juu)
